TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit DataFormats extends System.Object
public ref class DataFormats abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides a set of predefined data format names that can be used to identify data formats available in the clipboard or drag-and-drop operations.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface use the static formats defined by <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats> to describe each data format that is stored in a data object. Data objects are typically used for transferring data to and from the system clipboard, and in drag-and-drop operations.
The following table lists the values of the static data format fields provided by <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats>. These field values are provided for informational purposes only; in general, code should always refer to the appropriate field, rather than hard-coded strings.
|Field|Field Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap>|"Bitmap"|Specifies a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_win](~/includes/tlasharptla-win-md.md)] bitmap data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.CommaSeparatedValue>|"CSV"|Specifies a comma-separated value (CSV) data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Dib>|"DeviceIndependentBitmap"|Specifies the device-independent bitmap (DIB) data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Dif>|"DataInterchangeFormat"|Specifies the Windows Data Interchange Format (DIF) data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.EnhancedMetafile>|"EnhancedMetafile"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] enhanced metafile format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop>|"FileDrop"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] file drop format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Html>|"HTML Format"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_html](~/includes/tlasharptla-html-md.md)] data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Locale>|"Locale"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] locale (culture) data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.MetafilePicture>|"MetaFilePict"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] metafile picture data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.OemText>|"OEMText"|Specifies the standard [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] OEM text data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Palette>|"Palette"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] palette data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.PenData>|"PenData"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] pen data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Riff>|"RiffAudio"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_riff](~/includes/tlasharptla-riff-md.md)] audio data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Rtf>|"Rich Text Format"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_rtf](~/includes/tlasharptla-rtf-md.md)] data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Serializable>|"PersistentObject"|Specifies a data format that encapsulates any type of serializable data objects.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.StringFormat>|"System.String"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_clr](~/includes/tlasharptla-clr-md.md)] string class data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.SymbolicLink>|"SymbolicLink"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] symbolic link data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Text>|"Text"|Specifies the ANSI text data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Tiff>|"TaggedImageFileFormat"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText>|"UnicodeText"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_unicode](~/includes/tlasharptla-unicode-md.md)] text data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.WaveAudio>|"WaveAudio"|Specifies the wave audio data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Xaml>|"Xaml"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] data format.| |<xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.XamlPackage>|"XamlPackage"|Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] package data format.|

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Bitmap As String

remarks.format:
## Remarks A bitmap represents a computer graphic as an array of bits in memory, and these bits represent the attributes of the individual pixels in an image.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly CommaSeparatedValue As String

Docs.summary: Specifies a comma-separated value (CSV) data format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This format is a basic interchange format commonly used by spreadsheets.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Dib As String

remarks.format:
## Remarks DIB is a file format designed to ensure that bitmapped graphics created using one application can be loaded and displayed in another application exactly the way they appeared in the originating application.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Dif As String

Docs.summary: Specifies the Windows Data Interchange Format (DIF) data format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks DIF is a format consisting of ASCII codes in which database, spreadsheet, and similar documents can be structured to facilitate their use by and transfer to other programs.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly EnhancedMetafile As String

remarks.format:
## Remarks The enhanced metafile format is a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] file that stores an image in terms of graphic objects rather than pixels. When resized, a metafile preserves an image better than a bitmap.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly FileDrop As String

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this format to interact with shell file drags during drag-and-drop operations.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

Docs.summary: Returns a object that defines a name and numeric ID for a specified data format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method can also be used to register new formats. If the specified format cannot be found, it is automatically registered as a new data format.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.DataFormat GetDataFormat(int32 id) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetDataFormat (id As Integer) As DataFormat

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The numeric ID of the data format to request a object for.
Docs.summary: Returns a object that defines a name and numeric ID for the specified data format. The desired data format is specified by numeric ID.
Docs.returns: A object that contains the numeric ID and the name of the requested data format.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method can also be used to register new formats. If the specified format cannot be found, it is automatically registered as a new data format.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.DataFormat GetDataFormat(string format) cil managed
Public Shared Function GetDataFormat (format As String) As DataFormat

Docs.param: The name of the data format to request a object for.
Docs.summary: Returns a object that defines a name and numeric ID for the specified data format. The desired data format is specified by name (a string).
Docs.returns: A object that contains the numeric ID and the name of the requested data format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method can also be used to register new formats. If the specified format cannot be found, it is automatically registered as a new data format.
Use of this method requires that the caller have <xref:System.Security.Permissions.UIPermission> with the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.UIPermissionClipboard.AllClipboard?displayProperty=nameWithType>
flag set. The following code shows the attribute syntax to request this permission for an assembly.
```csharp [assembly: SecurityPermissionAttribute(SecurityAction.RequestMinimum, Flags = UIPermissionClipboard.AllClipboard)] ```
```vb <assembly: SecurityPermissionAttribute(SecurityAction.RequestMinimum, Flags := UIPermissionClipboard.AllClipboard)> ```

Docs.permission: for accessing low-level unmanaged code that supports the registration of clipboard formats. Associated enumeration:

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly MetafilePicture As String

Docs.summary: Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] metafile picture data format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The metafile picture format is a Windows file that stores an image in terms of graphic objects rather than pixels. When resized, a metafile preserves an image better than a bitmap.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_riff](~/includes/tla2sharptla-riff-md.md)] is a broad-based specification, designed to be used in defining standard formats for different types of multimedia files.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Rtf As String

remarks.format:
## Remarks RTF is an adaptation of Document Content Architecture that is used for transferring formatted text documents between applications.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. Docs.summary: Specifies the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] symbolic link data format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A symbolic link is a disk directory entry that takes the place of a directory entry for a file, but is actually a reference to a file in a different directory. A symbolic link may also be referred to an alias, shortcut, soft link, or symlink.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This data format denotes 16-bit character encoded Unicode, also referred to as UTF-16, and UCS-2.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Xaml As String

remarks.format:
## Remarks XAML is an XML-based language used to represent a tree of objects. Events generated by these objects can be handled using any [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_net](~/includes/tlasharptla-net-md.md)] programming language. In [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)], [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] is typically used to describe user interfaces (UI), documents, and media experiences.
This field is used by the <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> class and other classes that implement the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface to describe an available data format.
Use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.SetData%2A> method to add data with a corresponding format to a data object; use this field with the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> method to retrieve data in the corresponding format. To check whether a data object contains data in this format, use the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetDataPresent%2A> method to query for the format.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly XamlPackage As String
